com.devpaul.analogsticklib

Interface OnAnalogMoveListener


  • public interface OnAnalogMoveListener

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAnalogMove(float x, float y)
      Returns the raw x and y coordinates of the center stick relative to the center of the larger circle.
      void onAnalogMovedGetAngle(float angle)
      Returns the current angle of the analog stick.
      void onAnalogMovedGetQuadrant(Quadrant quadrant)
      Returns the quadrant location of the analog stick.
      void onAnalogMovedScaledX(float scaledX)
      Returns a scaled version of the x value.
      void onAnalogMovedScaledY(float scaledY)
      Returns a scaled version of the y value.

    • Method Detail

      • onAnalogMove

        void onAnalogMove(float x,
                  float y)
        Returns the raw x and y coordinates of the center stick relative to the center of the larger circle.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate

      • onAnalogMovedScaledX

        void onAnalogMovedScaledX(float scaledX)
        Returns a scaled version of the x value. This is based on the max value set
        Parameters:
        scaledX - the scaled x value. The most it can be is the max that was set.

      • onAnalogMovedScaledY

        void onAnalogMovedScaledY(float scaledY)
        Returns a scaled version of the y value. This is based on the max y value set.
        Parameters:
        scaledY - the scaled y value. The most it can be is the max that was set.

      • onAnalogMovedGetAngle

        void onAnalogMovedGetAngle(float angle)
        Returns the current angle of the analog stick. This is measured counterclockwise from the right half of the x axis of the larger circle.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle in degrees.

      • onAnalogMovedGetQuadrant

        void onAnalogMovedGetQuadrant(Quadrant quadrant)
        Returns the quadrant location of the analog stick.
        Parameters:
        quadrant - the quadrant its in. See Quadrant for more info.
